item.title: Free client.java here (very updated)!
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

Bro you have brackets everywhere, whats up with that, seriously.

case 10284: if (objectID == 10284) { // Barrows Chest if (playerHasItemAmount(605, 1)==true) if (playerHasItemAmount(989, 1)==true) if (playerHasItemAmount(788, 1)==true) if (playerHasItemAmount(1542, 1)==true) if (playerHasItemAmount(1590, 1)==true) if (playerHasItemAmount(993, 1)==true) PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName +" has just completed the barrow chest mini game!"); addItem(Item2.randomVerac(), 1); heightLevel = 0; startAnimation(862); } else { sendMessage("You need all 6 barrow keys to get the prize!"); } break;

item.title: Free client.java here (very updated)!
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

The one I gave him worked perfectly, you just put it in the wrong spot, Myself, I didn’t use case 132 for it.

I just searched for

if (objectID ==

And under that last }, I added this:

if (objectID == 10284) { if (playerHasItem(2840) && playerHasItem(2838) && playerHasItem(2836) && playerHasItem(2834) && playerHasItem(2832) && playerHasItem(2411)) { deleteItem(2840, 1); deleteItem(2838, 1); deleteItem(2836, 1); deleteItem(2834, 1); deleteItem(2832, 1); deleteItem(2411, 1); int[] items = { 4708, 4710, 4712, 4714, 4716, 4718, 4720, 4722, 4724, 4726, 4728, 4730, 4732, 4734, 4736, 4738, 4745, 4747, 4749, 4751, 4753, 4755, 4757, 4759 }; int r = (int) (Math.random() * items.length); addItem(items[r], 1); teleportToX = 2611; teleportToY = 3095; sendMessage("You recieve an Item from the Barrows Chest."); } else { sendMessage("You need all the keys before you can open the Barrows Chest!"); } }

Read full topic
